item.title: 'Rogue' tour guides threaten Gold Coast glow-worm population
item.description: Last year two operators were fined for running glow-worm cave tours in the Springbrook and Tamborine national parks without the required permits.

item.title: Australia knocked out of under-19 Cricket World Cup by England
item.description: Ollie Peake's hobbling and defiant captain's knock of 100 has proved too little too late to rescue Australia as their reign as under-19 World Cup champions was ended by England in a compelling semifinal in Zimbabwe.

item.title: 'Bloodbath' at Washington Post as massive layoffs announced
item.description: The Jeff Bezos-owned paper, which famously brought down US President Richard Nixon, will drastically cut back in size and lay off workers in all its departments.

item.title: Strict caps on bottled water extraction urged for World Heritage-listed Springbrook
item.description: A long-awaited study warns that the extraction of bottled water from the World Heritage-listed Springbrook area poses a potential risk to the ancient Gondwana rainforests and should be strictly limited.

item.title: What Israel's President Isaac Herzog has said about Gaza, and why he won't be arrested in Australia
item.description: When Israel's president lands in Australia this weekend, he can expect an official red carpet treatment. But he will be all too aware of the controversy his visit is generating.

item.title: Georgia Voll helps Royal Challengers Bengaluru win Indian Women's Premier League
item.description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru pulled off the biggest successful chase in the Women's Premier League to win their second title in the Indian franchise-based T20 league.

item.title: Beyond the Songs Inside: After the applause
item.description: Creative prison programs are celebrated for their ability to heal and transform incarcerated people. But are they enough to break the cycle?

item.title: Josh Hazlewood out of T20 World Cup with injury in another blow to Australia's hopes
item.description: Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of Australia's T20 World Cup campaign as he continues to recover from the injuries which kept him from playing in the summer's Ashes series.

item.title: Three people die, three others including child injured in car crash south of Brisbane
item.description: Two cars collided on Waterford Tamborine Road in Yarrabilba yesterday afternoon, leaving three people dead and three others with serious injuries.

item.title: Rain brings relief and road closures after record heatwave in South Australia
item.description: High rainfall in north-eastern South Australia brings some relief for pastoralists after record-breaking heat, with a reprieve expected for metropolitan Adelaide this week.

item.title: ASIO was told about Bondi shooter's terrorist links years before attack, former spy claims
item.description: The former undercover agent spied on the Akrams when he infiltrated a Sydney IS terror cell for Australia's intelligence agency.

item.title: 'Massive' Indonesian ghost barge washes up on tiny Torres Strait island
item.description: The barge drifted into Australian waters from Indonesia after breaking from its moorings during bad weather.

item.title: More people say they'll vote One Nation. What are they voting for?
item.description: One Nation questions if man-made climate change is real, wants to wind back access to abortion care and plans to pay the HECS debts of doctors working in the regions.

item.title: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark was jailed but his community says legal issues persist
item.description: Former ATSIC leader Geoff Clark was jailed in 2024, yet some members of his community say legal issues linger on.

item.description: Animal welfare groups are calling for a major overhaul into the system that allows native animals to be killed in NSW.

item.title: Commonwealth asks to meet Roblox following reports of child grooming. Here's what we know
item.description: Roblox has been called to an urgent meeting with the federal government in the wake of reports that children are being groomed by predators and exposed to sexually explicit material on the popular online gaming platform.

item.title: Elvis Presley 'unguarded' in unseen footage used in new Baz Luhrmann film
item.description: When director Baz Luhrmann and his team uncovered hours of previously unseen Elvis Presley recordings, Luhrmann abandoned his original plans, deciding to "get out of the way" and let Presley tell his own story.

item.title: Iran's rulers face 'defections and disobedience', but will it be enough to topple the regime?
item.description: As talks between Washington and Tehran over a nuclear deal continue, fractures within the regime are starting to emerge.

item.title: Australian T20 World Cup squad looks different but do not count it out, Mitch Marsh says
item.description: Despite a slew of key injuries leaving the Australian team unrecognisable, captain Mitch Marsh is confident about the experience left in the side.

item.title: Surgeon Kelvin Kong's life growing up Chinese and Indigenous in Australia
item.description: Australia's first identified First Nations surgeon, Dr Kelvin Kong spoke about his Malaysian Chinese heritage during the annual Wang Gungwu lecture at Parliament House.

item.title: Socceroos striker Mo Toure scores hat-trick on starting debut in English Championship for Norwich
item.description: Mohamed Toure moved to England recently on a $5 million deal and it is already looking like a great decision for the 21-year-old forward.

item.title: Doongmabulla Springs decision leaves Qld government to weigh appeal or face trial
item.description: Wangan and Jagalingou peoples await the state government's next move after a win in their fight to have alleged damage to a sacred site near a mine in Central Queensland investigated.

item.title: Indonesia readies up to 8,000 troops for Board of Peace efforts in Gaza
item.description: The move makes Indonesia the first country to clearly commit troops to a multinational peacekeeping effort in the war-torn enclave.

item.title: Axed literary magazine Meanjin is resurrected by Queensland University of Technology
item.description: The 85-year-old literary journal Meanjin will return to Brisbane, where it was first published, after it was controversially closed by Melbourne University Press last year.

item.title: Australia cruises to victory over Ireland in T20 World Cup opener
item.description: Australia beats Ireland by 67 runs to win its first game at the T20 World Cup, after captain Mitch Marsh was a late out due to testicular bleeding.

item.title: Transparency concerns as Bougainville's Panguna mine that sparked civil war on path to reopen
item.description: The Autonomous Bougainville Government signs a secretive deal to reopen the huge Panguna gold and copper mine that sparked a catastrophic civil war three decades ago.

item.title: South Africa beats Afghanistan at Twenty20 World Cup after two super overs at Narendra Modi Stadium
item.description: South Africa wins the most dramatic T20 World Cup group stage clash with Afghanistan, featuring two super overs and countless twists of fortune.

item.title: Former Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou says Spurs 'not a big club' in wake of Thomas Frank sacking
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur are "not a big club" because of their policy in the transfer market, former manager Ange Postecoglou has said in the wake of the London club's sacking of head coach Thomas Frank on Wednesday.

item.title: Albany Woollen Mills' 101 years celebrated via shared love of blankets
item.description: Established in 1925, Western Australia's first and only woollen mill transformed raw wool into fabric and blankets, becoming a cornerstone of Albany's industry before closing in 2002.

item.title: What to know about the Year of the Horse and Lunar New Year celebrations in Australia
item.description: The Year of the Horse is here and 2026 is a rare "Red Horse" year. Find out what it means, which zodiac animal you are, and how Lunar New Year is celebrated across Australia.

item.title: Ley didn't define herself by her gender but women might relate to her workplace woes
item.description: The issue for the Liberal Party is not simply the toppling of a female leader. It's also about what happened to that leader while she was in the job.

item.title: From Japan to Israel, elections are reshaping global politics
item.description: At a time when so much of the global conversation is about the rapid decline of democracy, it is striking what a huge impact elections are having on world events just now.

item.title: Easy, tasty and nutritious recipes for sharing this Ramadan
item.description: Looking for easy, nutritious Ramadan recipes? These options will help you prepare for and break your fast well.

item.title: Innovative cattle loading ramp puts animal welfare at centre of design
item.description: A retired truck driver has developed a wide, steel, cattle-loading ramp that allows animals to walk side by side, mimicking natural herd behaviour and reducing noise, agitation and the risk of injury during transport.

item.title: Easy ways to help protect your hair from chlorine and saltwater damage
item.description: Regular beach days or laps at the local pool can leave our hair looking and feeling quite different.

item.title: NT film industry on national stage as Kangaroo, Top End Bub and Journey Home win AACTA Awards
item.description: The NT's small but mighty presence is shining on the global stage 40 years after Crocodile Dundee rocketed its film industry into the stratosphere.

item.title: Statues of Amy Sherwin, Australia's first opera star, unveiled at Hobart's Hadley's Hotel in bid to cement legacy
item.description: An effort to bring new recognition to a Tasmanian opera star who became world famous, but who died poor, culminates in the unveiling of two statues of her in Hobart.

item.description: The Indigenous team overturns a 14-0 deficit to score a rousing comeback win over the Maori in the Women's All Stars clash.

item.title: Indigenous and Māori All Stars play out dramatic 16-all draw
item.description: It went down to the final seconds, but the Indigenous and Maori NRL All Stars could not be separated with both sides left to rue missed chances after a 16-all draw.

item.title: City of Melbourne quiet on plan for Southbank's 'ugly' red stairs, long after design competition announced
item.description: A Melbourne council unveiled a lucrative competition to replace Southbank's much-derided red stairs. But a year after it was due to start, the plan appears to have gone nowhere.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: The anxiety and joy of dual moguls bronze for Matt Graham, leader and captain of the Australian team
item.description: Matt Graham's brilliant bronze in the dual moguls, and the incredible response from his teammates, proved to everyone that he is the true leader of this Winter Olympic squad.

item.description: Angus Taylor wrote to the prime minister pitching the plan just days after being elected leader of the Liberal Party.

item.description: US President Donald Trump says the first meeting of his newly created Board of Peace will take place on Thursday, with over $7 billion to be pledged for reconstruction and humanitarian efforts in Gaza.

item.title: New tobacco laws proposed by WA government to target stores selling illegal cigarettes, vapes
item.description: Western Australia could soon have some of the nation's toughest illegal tobacco penalties, including fines of up to $21 million and hefty prison terms for possessing commercial quantities of illicit products.

item.description: A leaked copy of the Liberal Party's migration policy prepared before Sussan Ley was ousted included plans to "elevate" the current non-binding Australian values statement.

item.title: Angus Taylor bets on migration politics amid global rightward shift
item.description: If migration is treated primarily as a cultural fault line, rather than an economic system embedded in national growth, the debate will remain loud. The structural reform will remain unfinished.

item.title: How to decide what type of car insurance is best for you
item.description: Choosing the right car insurance option can feel daunting, but it's the kind of task that it pays to get right. So, how can you decide which type is most suitable for you?

item.title: Results show high levels of lead contamination in dust around Hobart, as EPA flags further tests
item.description: High levels of lead contamination have been found in dust samples taken from suburban locations close to Nyrstar's Hobart zinc smelter, documents obtained by the ABC show.

item.title: Interest rate hike worries? Here's some good news
item.description: Fresh warnings of further rate rises have been enough to send shivers up the collective spine of new homeowners, but if there's any comfort to be had, it's this: Don't believe a word of the forecasts.

item.description: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner calls for tough new laws forcing companies to take slavery in their supply chains seriously, as Ansell and Kmart face scrutiny.

item.description: The Irish Rugby Football Union has said it will launch an investigation after turning comments off a social media post that congratulated the country's newest Test debutant.

item.description: Almost two years after a state government report revealed 35 per cent of all buildings within the Department for Education's portfolio were past their design life, many schools are still plagued with issues including mould, asbestos and rotting windows.

item.description: Australia has made limited progress in clearing a passage for the Australian women and their children, citing safety issues in and around the camps, and security concerns back home.

item.description: Huge crowds have flocked to live shows for the popular and influential Pod Save America podcast, suggesting Australia's obsession with US politics isn't going away anytime soon.

item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese insists the federal government will not repatriate the Australian families with links to Islamic State fighters who remain in Syria.

item.description: A project with dozens of monitoring sites across the Queensland property confirms the presence of the critically endangered plains-wanderer by analysing bird calls.

item.description: Vanessa Turnbull-Roberts says she stepped down as the ACT's first Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children and young people commissioner to prioritise her safety after being subjected to sexual harassment and sexual assault by a public servant.

item.description: A long-running saga in country women's football is set to close as a central Victorian team that had been left without a competition will now be allowed to play in 2026.

item.description: The two-time Democratic presidential hopeful remembered for powerful speeches died peacefully surrounded by loved ones, his family said.

item.description: Despite China's President Xi Jinping warning the US not to send weapons to Taiwan, Donald Trump says he will make a decision soon.

item.description: In the 1994 French play Art, Serge spends 160,000 euros on an all-white painting, horrifying his friend Marc. It might just wreck their decades-long friendship.

item.description: British economist Gary Stevenson is on a speaking tour, warning Australia will follow the path of the UK with "poverty exploding" unless politicians deal with inequality.

item.description: Riders embroiled in a dispute over pay and conditions with food delivery company HungryPanda in Sydney say Chinese police have asserted pressure back home to stop them protesting.

item.description: In the 1990s, a group of Indigenous women were accused of fabricating claims of sacred sites to stop the construction of a bridge south of Adelaide. It was a decision that has impacted a community for decades.

item.description: Sources say the actions will likely affect Aboriginal communities and that the investigation was not shared with the public.

item.description: Iran says it temporarily closed the Strait of Hormuz — a vital international shipping route — as it entered a new round of talks with the US over its nuclear capabilities.

item.description: The One Nation leader qualified her earlier remarks, which had been met with condemnation, while reiterating calls for tougher vetting processes for Muslim migrants.

item.description: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior accuses an opponent of racially abusing him during a Champions League game against Benfica, leading to the game being halted for nearly 10 minutes.

item.description: The ABC's managing director says its current Adelaide bureau could be redeveloped in a similar way to an apartment building nearby, while the premier says affordable apartments will still be included on the new CBD site.

item.title: Is it ever a good idea to stay together for the kids?

item.description: The scourge of AI-slopaganda, viral disinformation campaigns and online attacks against individuals and institutions is going to get far worse before it gets better, if the latest public hearings on the topic are any indication.

item.title: The Board of Peace meant to rebuild Gaza may well end up as another monument to Donald Trump
item.description: Unless the Board of Peace begins to focus and genuinely tries to make the world a better place, this may well prove to be yet another monument to Donald Trump.

item.title: Eileen Gu says JD Vance is 'sweet' for saying she should be competing for US at 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Eileen Gu says she is flattered that JD Vance thinks she should be competing for the US, but feels his comments are driven by an anti-China bias from Washington.

item.title: What to watch, read and listen to this weekend: Eternity, "Wuthering Heights" and new Meg Mac
item.description: From a cursed vagina to a classic retold, there's plenty of culture to dig into this weekend.

item.title: Kyra Wheatley ready to ride the chaos and speed of ski cross at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: The speed and chaos of ski cross is what attracted Kyra Wheatley to the sport, and to realise a dream 12 years in the making of competing at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Scientists model best-case and worst-case climate scenarios for Antarctica
item.description: Scientists say parts of Antarctica face "devastating" and "irreversible" impacts from climate change unless urgent action is taken to limit greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: Glider pilot creates aviation history in Central Australia flying 1,266 kilometres
item.description: A Queensland pilot has made aviation history in Central Australia, flying more than 1,200 kilometres without an engine in a record-breaking glider flight launched from Alice Springs.

item.title: Ellyse Perry's evolution cements greatness as Australian cricket milestone looms
item.description: Cricket superstar Ellyse Perry will become the first woman to play 350 matches for Australia across all formats on Saturday.

item.title: Cockroaches peer out of a communications access hole in Adelaide
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police receive 'reports of crime' in relation to Pauline Hanson interview
item.description: One Nation senator Pauline Hanson accuses the government of trying to put her "back in jail", after police received reports of a crime in relation to the senator's inflammatory comments about Muslims during a media interview.

item.title: Norway sets Winter Olympics record with 17th gold medal
item.description: Norway breaks its own record for the most gold medals won by a nation at a single Winter Olympics.

item.title: Australia blows Oman away to end T20 World Cup campaign with a bang
item.description: Australia has flogged Oman, chasing down 105 in less than 10 overs to end a disappointing World Cup campaign on a high. Follow live.

item.title: Man whose girlfriend froze to death after he left her mountain convicted of manslaughter
item.description: A man who left his girlfriend to freeze to death on an Austrian mountain has been handed a five-month suspended sentence for manslaughter.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein's estate agrees to pay up to $US35 million to settle class action
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's estate has agreed to pay as much as $US35 million to resolve a class action lawsuit, according to a court filing on Thursday.

item.title: Trump vows to resurrect global tariffs after Supreme Court strikes them down
item.description: The US president says he is "absolutely ashamed" of members of the court who struck down his global tariffs after finding he lacked the authority to implement them.

item.title: UK government to consider removing Andrew from succession line, as royal protection police face grilling
item.description: The UK government is to look at removing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the line of succession, an official says, as royal protection police face a grilling on "anything they saw or heard".

item.title: Putin is betting Ukraine and the West run out of resources first
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is betting that the West and Ukraine will run out of resources first.

item.title: Should Labor do its own refresh after Angus Taylor's Liberal 'rebrand'?
item.description: In the past few days, in a series of largely ignored milestones overshadowed by news of Angus Taylor's new frontbench, Albanese overtook Scott Morrison and John Curtin to become the 12th-longest serving prime minister.

item.title: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge of Ninja Turtles, Netflix and nagging pain
item.description: Every question has only two options: One is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

item.title: Andy Griffiths, author of the Treehouse books, named new Australian Children's Laureate
item.description: Famous for writing stories about toilets and tree houses, the bestselling kids' author is taking on a new challenge on the national stage.

item.title: 15 of your modern dating stories
item.description: From awkward introductions over a can of soft drink to life-changing lunches, here are some of the stories ABC readers told us about their modern dating experiences.

item.title: The town that turned its back on a rape victim
item.description: A local footy star and his mate are convicted of raping their friend. In the tiny town of Balmoral, where the footy club reigns, the town makes it clear whose story they believe.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's future uncertain under monarch willing to let 'the law take its course'
item.description: Like so many of the elite caught in Epstein's web, Andrew believed he would escape scrutiny for his behaviour. But it is precisely because of his name and position that his alleged wrongdoing has now delivered him into the hands of the law.

item.title: Why Pacific Islands are rapidly de-flagging Russia's fleet of 'shadow tankers'
item.description: Pacific Islands are rapidly de-flagging vessels on their shipping registries after gaining international attention for their role in Russia's "shadow fleet".

item.title: Landholders fear large-scale battery project will impact Mount Gambier housing developments
item.description: Landholders call for a proposed 500-megawatt battery energy storage project to be moved amid concerns it will impact on housing developments in South Australia's second largest city.

item.title: Nathan Cleary facing two-match suspension over high hit in Panthers' trial loss to Wests Tigers
item.description: Nathan Cleary can accept a two-match suspension with an early plea after his high hit on Wests Tigers star Heamasi Makasini.

item.title: Eileen Gu calls Australian teen Indra Brown 'the real deal' ahead of 2026 Winter Olympics freeski halfpipe final
item.description: Australian teen Indra Brown's spectacular rise to Winter Olympic medal contender has been stunning to watch, but defending freeski champion Eileen Gu says it's not a surprise.

item.title: At Melbourne's Mission to Seafarers, a small team keeps an invisible global workforce afloat
item.description: In a 109-year-old building wedged between mirrored high-rises in Melbourne's CBD, a volunteer team supports a little-known workforce that spends months at a time at sea.

item.title: Scientists recommend succulents to protect buildings from bushfires
item.description: As bushfires become more frequent, scientists say garden beds can be a line of defence.

item.title: The art and origins of the courtroom sketch
item.description: They're a small and curious cohort in a line of work rapidly evolving. Welcome to the world of courtroom artists.

item.title: Peregrine falcon drone could save Australian fruit and almond orchards from hungry birds
item.description: A new falcon drone wards off peckish birds that have been destroying valuable fruit crops.

item.title: Peter Malinauskas is heading for a landslide win in SA. How crushing a victory will it be?
item.description: Even if it's a Labor landslide, we'll learn a lot from next month's South Australian election, writes Casey Briggs.

item.title: Manchester United owner Jim Ratcliffe avoids sanctions after saying UK has been 'colonised' by immigrants
item.description: Jim Ratcliffe is reminded of his responsibilities as a participant in English football but is not handed any penalties from FA after his controversial call.

item.title: Inquiry into Queensland child safety hears child had 22 foster carers by age 13
item.description: Details of a child's tumultuous journey to adulthood under the stewardship of Queensland's Department of Child Safety have been laid bare in a Toowoomba inquiry this week.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest shows money talks louder than women's testimony
item.description: Why is an email about the trade trip apparently more compelling than the detailed and painful evidence of a woman?

item.title: Man and 15yo boy charged over shooting of former NRL player Matt Utai
item.description: Police allege a 25-year-old man was responsible for the shooting of former NRL player Matt Utai, while a 15-year-old drove the getaway car.

item.title: Campbell Newman argues new Queensland hate speech laws going down 'dangerous path'
item.description: The new laws will allow the government to ban phrases it deems problematic by regulation once the legislation passes state parliament.

item.title: Farmer's hands-off approach creates unusual lamb with distinct flavour chefs say is like nothing else in Australia
item.description: When Frank was forced to sell the sheep he'd been farming for more than 20 years, something had to change. His "experiment" is helping expats feel at home.

item.title: After 60 years, there are fears Myer may walk away from Launceston's CBD
item.description: Community and business leaders say the possible departure of retailer Myer would leave a "giant hole" in the heart of the city's shopping district.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn goes 'bionic' as the curling war of words continues — day 14 quick hits
item.description: Swedish curler Oskar Eriksson hits Canadian nemesis Marc Kennedy with his most devastating barb yet as Lindsey Vonn shares an update on her recovery. Here are the quick hits from day 14 at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Queensland woman wakes from coma after contracting meningitis and septic shock on ski holiday to Japan
item.description: When 24-year-old Anna Gallo woke up shivering in a Tokyo hotel, she thought it was food poisoning. Hours later, she was in a coma fighting for her life against a disease she thought she was vaccinated against.

item.title: Cattle tick outbreak raises questions over Queensland's biosecurity
item.description: Queensland is known for its hardline biosecurity stance against foreign pests, but farmers say a recent cattle tick outbreak has exposed systemic weaknesses.

item.title: Americans fearing death of democracy see a glimmer of hope in the Supreme Court
item.description: Until now, Donald Trump has been one of the most unstoppable presidents ever. But the Supreme Court's tariffs decision proves there are limits to his power.

item.title: North-west Queensland on high alert as deluge continues and rivers rise
item.description: Flooding is likely to become more widespread in northern and western Queensland over the next few days, with further heavy rainfall and road closures expected.

item.title: Daly River flood evacuees to return home after more than two weeks in Darwin
item.description: After spending more than a fortnight sleeping at a Darwin evacuation centre 220 kilometres away from their flooded community, bus loads of Daly River locals are set to return home.

item.title: Woman found dead after a house fire near Newcastle
item.description: Police are investigating the cause of a fatal house fire at Port Stephens, north of Newcastle.

item.title: Bayern Munich coach Vincent Kompany says José Mourinho made 'huge mistake' attacking Vinícius Júnior's character after alleged racist insult
item.description: Bayern Munich manager Vincent Kompany dissects the racism row involving Real Madrid and Brazil star Viní Jr with a passionate 12-minute speech.

item.title: Lavender growers say watered-down oil imports are pricing them out
item.description: Despite an Australian lavender industry dating back to the 1850s, you're more than likely using an imported and "watered-down" product, local growers say.

item.title: Herby potato salad with green beans and tuna - ABC News
item.description: Turn a potato salad into a tasty meal with pantry staples and fresh greens.

item.title: Crocodile attack in WA's Kimberley region prompts calls for more awareness
item.description: A man's close call with a saltwater crocodile in Western Australia's far north has prompted calls for more awareness in remote parts of the region.

item.title: Opposition does its best to land blows on WA government in parliament's first week back
item.description: Housing, health and household stress — that's what WA's opposition leader says he's focused on in 2026 as he and his party face an uphill battle against the state government.

item.title: Why economists hate low unemployment for inflation
item.description: The theory goes that if you have just the right amount of workers on the unemployment scrap heap, you can keep inflation in check. The problem is that no-one knows exactly what the magic unemployment rate is.

item.title: Two teenage boys killed in fatal car crash at Crabtree, in Tasmania's Huon Valley
item.description: Two teenage boys have died in a single vehicle crash in Tasmania's Huon valley overnight, with three others taken to hospital.

item.title: Women and children in Syrian camp "will end up in Australia" | Insiders On Background
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Potential release of carp control virus into waterways delayed until 2028
item.description: Release of a virus to control carp in Australian waterways has been delayed until 2028, a decade after it was initially slated for release.

item.title: Man charged with hate crime after allegedly ramming Brisbane synagogue with ute
item.description: It's alleged the 32-year-old rammed a ute into the gates of the Brisbane Synagogue on Margaret Street on Friday night.

item.title: Teagan Micah forced out of Matildas' Asian Cup campaign as concussion issues continue
item.description: Teagan Micah's horror run with concussions continues as she reveals she will miss the Matildas' upcoming Asian Cup campaign.

item.title: How Reuters captured that photo of former Prince Andrew leaving custody
item.description: The image, taken by Reuters photographer Phil Noble, went viral when it was published on Thursday. He says capturing the moment came down to a tip-off and more than a little luck.

item.title: Balinese women find shared culture and community in WA's Pilbara
item.description: The Pilbara is known for spinifex and mining, but has also become a melting pot of cultures from across the globe.

item.title: I had a miscarriage over the summer. It was nothing like I expected
item.description: My understanding of miscarriage was built on a handful of Hollywood representations and snatches of stories I'd read. Outside of this, I had few reference points.

item.title: A 'return to craft' for the NT's award-winning young artists showcased at this year's Exit Art
item.description: Almost a dozen high school-aged artists have received awards as part of a prestigious Northern Territory showcase, with a number of finalists exhibiting self-portraits.

item.title: Concerns over death of iconic salmon gums in WA's Great Western Woodlands
item.description: Kalgoorlie horticulturalist Phil Stanley says he is struggling to get authorities to take the deaths of more than 100 salmon gums near the mining city seriously.

item.title: Anna Murdoch-Mann, author and ex-wife of Rupert Murdoch, dies aged 81
item.description: The author, journalist and philanthropist was Rupert Murdoch's "active partner" in his media empire News Corp over their 31-year marriage.

item.title: Displaced on the dial by changes to Perth's FM spectrum, Kalamunda community radio is undeterred
item.description: Kalamunda Community Radio has been providing a local radio service on 102.5FM to the Perth Hills for more than 25 years, but has now had to move frequency as the ABC switches its Perth radio services to FM.

item.title: Adam Zampa says claims Australia does not care about T20 cricket 'totally false' after World Cup flop
item.description: Adam Zampa hits back at claims that Australia does not care about T20 cricket after a disappointing World Cup campaign.

item.title: How a window opened for IS-linked Australians to leave Syria
item.description: After holding a large swathe of autonomous territory that included two detention camps, Kurdish-led forces are now reluctantly handing over control to Syrian government forces, following their successful military offensive.

item.title: The shamans and designer handbags before Yoon Suk Yeol's insurrection conviction
item.description: Former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol's sentence for insurrection comes after a tumultuous era of shamanism, Chanel bags and conspiracy theories.

item.title: How a Belgian techno producer with some old synthesisers has reimagined Terminator 2
item.description: Terminator 2: Judgment Day is getting the live score treatment, but not in the way you might expect.
